title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 08:27  
sdumitriu - (08:27): mflorea: Ping  
mflorea - (08:28): sdumitriu: pong  
sdumitriu - (08:28): There's a problem caused by your fix for XWIKI-5479  
mflorea - (08:28): what problem?  
sdumitriu - (08:28): You added cssparser as a dependency, and it breaks the PDF styling support  
mflorea - (08:28): hmm, why is that?  
mflorea - (08:29): how does cssparser affect pdf styling support?  
sdumitriu - (08:29): Since the PDF export uses CSS4J, and cssparser is not compatible with css4j  
mflorea - (08:30): hmm, ok, but note that tmortagne did recently some changes to the XHTMLParser and he used also cssparser  
sdumitriu - (08:30): cssparser expects certain implementation for DocumentHandler  
sdumitriu - (08:30): css4j sets its own DocumentHandler  
sdumitriu - (08:30): And cssparser ignores it  
sdumitriu - (08:31): The idea is that you used the css parser in a wrong way  
sdumitriu - (08:31): You explicitly used the implementation  
mflorea - (08:31): hmm  
sdumitriu - (08:32): The correct way would be to either request one from the w3 helper classes, or instantiate the one configured in System.getProperty("org.w3c.css.sac.parser")  
sdumitriu - (08:32): This way it wouldn't matter what implementation is available  
sdumitriu - (08:32): And we already had the css parser provided by css4j  
mflorea - (08:33): you mean http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/SAC/doc/org/w3c/css/sac/helpers/ParserFactory.html  
sdumitriu - (08:34): Yep  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 08:34  
mflorea - (08:34): ok, I'll fix the code and I'll talk to tmortagne to fix the XHTMLParser (if he did the same mistake)  
mflorea - (08:35): and I'll drop the csspaser dependency if you say that CSS4J provides such a parser  
mflorea - (08:35): thanks for catching this. I guess 2.5 is busted.. :(  
sdumitriu - (08:35): A bit  
sdumitriu - (08:35): PDF styling is not something that common  
sdumitriu - (08:36): But there are users that do it, though  
sdumitriu - (08:36): And it's also needed by Mihai for Network  
mflorea - (08:36): we can release a 2.5.1 soon, since we found and fix an important bug yesterday  
sdumitriu - (08:37): I don't think tmortagne did the same, since there's only one reference to steadystate.css  
mflorea - (08:37): XWIKI-5617  
mflorea - (08:38): ok  
Stulle - (08:38): you're welcome about that one ;)  
sdumitriu - (08:38): Thanks Stulle  
sdumitriu - (08:38): Even bug reports are crucial contributions from the community :)  
mflorea - (08:38): yep, thanks for reporting it  
Stulle - (08:39): haha, you're welcome  
evalica joined #xwiki at 08:39  
evalica - (08:43): can someone fix the build process http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/2.6-SNAPSHOT/ ?  
sdumitriu - (08:44): Hm, broken  
sdumitriu - (08:44): Let me check  
Stulle - (08:46): please also note i reopened XWIKI-5618  
evalica - (08:48): sdumitriu: we need it to see the activity stream changes - we also downloaded the sources, but our local build doesn't refrect the changes ...  
sdumitriu - (08:49): mflorea: XWIKI-5625  
mflorea - (08:49): ok, thanks  
Stulle - (08:50): well, i noticed the PDF export was kinda bugged to boot with... it fails on a regular basis when i use lightbox images...  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 08:51

sdumitriu - (09:11): evalica: Committed, you can update and rebuild the activitystream plugin  
sdumitriu - (09:11): sburjan`: Awake?  
Stulle - (09:12): added a comment for XWIKI-5618 with my latest findings  
evalica - (09:13): sdumitriu: thanks  
Stulle - (09:13): huh??? why was the ticket closed again?  
Stulle - (09:13): this is still not fixed!  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:17  
rrodriguez left at 09:20 (Quit: rrodriguez  
Stulle - (09:21): mflorea: the HTML generated for me looks differently!  
mflorea - (09:21): what XE version are you using?  
Stulle - (09:21): for me it regulary puts the styles into <div  class=... or <div style=...  
Stulle - (09:21): 2.5...  
Stulle - (09:22): keeping it up to date with minimum delay since i setup 2.5 M1...  
mflorea - (09:22): are you trying the exact example from the issue description?  
sdumitriu - (09:22): Stulle: I have a fix for it  
mflorea - (09:22): I tried that example and vertical align was set on the right HTML element  
Stulle - (09:23): no the exact example i posted there but my actual table  
Stulle - (09:23): which, like i stated, is somewhat more complex  
mflorea - (09:23): well, you have to see what different  
mflorea - (09:23): s/what/what's  
Stulle - (09:23): could you give me a mail address to mail the exact stuff to you?  
Stulle - (09:24): because this is copyrighted material (IEC standards) and i don't want to be spreading it around in public..  
mflorea - (09:24): ok  
sdumitriu - (09:24): mflorea: What happens if I use vertical-align inherit?  
sdumitriu - (09:24): Does anything break in the WYSIWYG?  
sdumitriu - (09:24): I know there's a bug with IE and inherit and computed styles  
mflorea - (09:25): I'm not aware of any bugs  
mflorea - (09:25): re sdumitriu  
Stulle - (09:26): well, i used wiki to edit this time... but basically i could see no difference and i am viewing the page in view mode  
Stulle - (09:26): just gonna prepare the mail  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:30  
Stulle - (09:36): okay, email sent  
mflorea - (09:36): ok  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:37  
sdumitriu - (09:38): sburjan: Ping  
sburjan - (09:38): sdumitriu: pong  
sdumitriu - (09:38): Stulle: I have a fix for the vertical-align problem  
sdumitriu - (09:38): sburjan: Can you redo the images for http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial ?  
sdumitriu - (09:38): If you have the time  
Stulle - (09:39): cool but is this also gonna fix that style extension classes are not being applied to just one table?  
sburjan - (09:39): sdumitriu: ok, I will redo them today  
sdumitriu - (09:39): Stulle: How can it apply to just one table? That's not how CSS works  
sdumitriu - (09:40): If you want to target one table, use a specific selector  
sdumitriu - (09:40): Add an ID to the table  
Stulle - (09:40): well, that's what mflorea suggested yesterday  
Stulle - (09:40): and it's actually documented in the syntax guide  
Stulle - (09:40): see XWIKI-5618  
Stulle - (09:41): last example in mflorea's first comment  
sdumitriu - (09:41): evalica: Should we add the silk companion icons to XWiki?  
mflorea - (09:42): Stulle: you can use (% id="special" %) and then use #special in you skin extension. This way you target only that table  
Stulle - (09:43): yesterday you said i should just precede the table with (% class="alignBottom" %) or something thelike  
Stulle - (09:43): which i just mailed you and does not work  
Stulle - (09:44): using (% style="vertical-align: bottom" %) in the line before a table does not work either  
Stulle - (09:44): and using the exact same thing before a ((( group is of no use either  
sburjan - (09:44): sdumitriu: shouldnt I also delete the content prior from 2.4 from http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/TagApplication ?  
sdumitriu left at 09:47 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 09:47  
evalica - (09:47): sdumitriu: they are nice - I haven't found what I was looking for: attach\_add, attach\_edit, attach\_delete - had to do them my self - we don't need them right now, but they are a good place to look for when you need something  
jvelociter left at 09:47 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 09:48  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:48  
mflorea - (09:48): Stulle, I was explaining what sdumitriu suggested. If you want to target just a single table then you can use (% id="someUniqueId" %) instead of (% class="alignBottom" %) and then in your skin extension you write something like #someUniqueId td {vertical-align:bottom} . Of course, this will affect all the cells in the table. If you want to target only one cell, then you have too see what's different between the example from the issue description (which works  
Stulle - (09:50): okay, i get what he meant now but how can this relate to your comment yesterday? does it mean there are two ways, the one you suggested and the one from sdumitriu or is you one not capable of achieving the aim under certain circumstances or what?  
mflorea - (09:52): me and sdumitriu suggested the same thing: to use a skin extension. Whether you use a class name, i.e. (% class="someClassName" %) or an identifier, i.e. (% id="someUniqueIdentifier" %) it's just a small detail.  
Stulle - (09:53): ah, okay, that clears it up for me  
mflorea - (09:53): the only difference is that the class name can be used on multiple tables, while the id is just for one table  
mflorea - (09:53): but the effect is the same  
Stulle - (09:53): i see  
Stulle - (09:54): will try if the id way works for me when the class= way does not  
mflorea - (09:55): I doubt it, since it doesn't really matter in your case if you use id or class name  
Stulle - (09:55): okay, i'll trust you there, then ;)  
kwoot joined #xwiki at 09:55  
kwoot - (09:55): Hello, just want to say congrats on the gartner report. Is it already online somewhere?  
mflorea - (09:56): Stulle, I received your mail, I'll look at it a bit later

Stulle - (09:56): i'll be around  
vmassol - (09:56): kwoot: thanks. We would have loved to show the image of the quadrant but we are not allowed to…. I don't know if the report is avail, let me ask

Stulle - (10:36): and another one ;) XWIKI-5626  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:57  
vmassol - (10:58): guys xwiki-core doesn't build for me  
vmassol - (10:58): a test is in error: XWikiTest.testValidationKeyStorage  
vmassol - (10:59): sdumitriu: I think that's caused by your commit  
vmassol - (10:59): seems you haven't built xwiki-core after committting…. hehe  
vmassol - (10:59): s/after/before/  
vmassol - (11:00): I'm blocked for my commits though… I'll skip xwiki-core tests  
vmassol - (11:00): (need to rebuild the whole thing again though)  
vmassol - (11:01): (hmm maybe it's time to try the new maven flags -amp etc)  
sdumitriu - (11:02): vmassol: Where should an @RequiredAccessRight annotation be defined? component-api, velocity, a new module?  
sdumitriu - (11:03): vmassol: Yes, I know about the test  
sdumitriu - (11:03): It was broken by another fix  
vmassol - (11:04): sdumitriu: re anno, definitely not in component, nor velocity. Haven't thought about it. Maybe you should send a proposal so that we can understand where it's meant to be used, what use cases, etc?  
sdumitriu - (11:05): Use case: all public API methods could have an @RequredAccessRight("programming") annotation on them, which will be checked when called from Velocity  
vmassol - (11:06): sdumitriu: I do't think this is only related to velocity  
vmassol - (11:06): but to all calls coming from the outside  
sdumitriu - (11:06): (initially only velocity, later we might implement a custom security policy for all scripting languages as well)  
vmassol - (11:06): (be them from xmlrpc, rest, etc)  
sdumitriu - (11:06): If we have this policy in place, we'd be able to open all scripting languages for public use, without PR  
sburjan - (11:07): we should also fix XWIKI-5611  
vmassol - (11:07): I do't like introducing sometihng now that will only work for velocity  
vmassol - (11:07): I don't think it's right  
vmassol - (11:07): at the very least I'd like to see a global proposal to ensure that the one you would do now goes in the right direction  
lucaa left at 11:09 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:09  
vmassol - (11:10): ah found something interesting: mvn -rf <module name>  
mflorea - (11:15): sdumitriu: re XWIKI-5625 http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/SAC/doc/org/w3c/css/sac/helpers/ParserFactory.html is a SAC parser factory, but I need a CSS OM parser factory and I can't find one.. I'm looking also at http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/batik/javadoc/org/apache/batik/css/parser/Parser.html and it doesn't implement a CSS OM parser interface, because there isn't one.. For instance, http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/guide/plugin/dom/org/w3c/dom/css/p  
sdumitriu - (11:16): vmassol: One idea would be to put it in the xwiki-security-rightservice component from the contrib  
sdumitriu - (11:17): mflorea: Broken message, paste the oracle link again  
mflorea - (11:17): http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/guide/plugin/dom/org/w3c/dom/css/package-summary.html

SvenDowideit\_ is now known as SvenDowideit ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
sdumitriu - (11:33): vmassol: Broken test fixed  
mflorea - (11:33): sdumitriu: also batik css parser is a SAC parser and I don't see how I can get a CSSStyleDeclaration from it. I'm looking at http://www.informatica.info/projects/css/doc/api/ and I've no idea how I can get my CSSStyleDeclaration using CSS4j but without having to create DOM elements and so. CSSParser was perfect for me. Maybe we can fix the issue in a different way  
sdumitriu - (11:34): OK, let me check  
kwoot left at 11:35 (Quit: Page closed  
sdumitriu - (11:36): mflorea: OK, I think I have an idea  
npm left at 11:40 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
mflorea - (11:46): sdumitriu: I see two possible solutions: (1) backup and restore "org.w3c.css.sac.parser" system property before/after creating the CSSOMParser or (2) use the second constructor CSSOMParser(Parser sacParser) and pass a SAC parser created with ParserFactory.makeParser() WDYT?  
sdumitriu - (11:46): I'm setting the system property now  
sdumitriu - (11:46): Trying it  
sdumitriu - (11:48): PDF styling works  
sdumitriu - (11:48): mflorea: What should I try to make sure I didn't break your code?  
mflorea - (11:50): sdumitriu: [[image:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)||style="width:50px"]]  
sdumitriu - (11:51): Works  
sdumitriu - (11:52): (although there's a bug with resized transparent images, the transparency is replaced with black)  
mflorea - (11:52): oh, that's where the black border came from  
jbrBridge left at 11:52 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
cjdelisle left at 11:53 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
mflorea - (11:53): that's pretty bad  
sdumitriu - (11:54): Can you take care of that?  
lucaa left at 11:54 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea - (11:54): I'll investigate  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:54  
mflorea - (11:54): now, what do we do about XWIKI-5625  
sdumitriu - (11:55): I can commit the System.setProperty fix  
sdumitriu - (11:55): It's fast and works, although it's a hack  
sdumitriu - (11:55): (I explicitly reference the batik class, thus another hard-coded dependency)  
sdumitriu - (11:56): Can you try the second option you listed?  
mflorea - (11:56): with backup and restore?  
mflorea - (11:56): (the problem being that CSSParser sets the system property to its own SAC parser)  
mflorea - (11:57): in the default constructor that I'm using  
mflorea - (11:57): let me try it  
mflorea - (11:57): how can test the pdf styling?  
sdumitriu - (11:58): mflorea: No, the other constructor  
mflorea - (11:59): ok

mflorea - (11:59): ok

vmassol - (12:01): ok so we need to find someone who could work on it  
sdumitriu - (12:01): Trying to fix the PDF styling for Network  
sdumitriu - (12:01): And then I have to finish the email thing  
vmassol - (12:02): yep  
lucaa left at 12:06 (Quit: Leaving.

sdumitriu - (12:20): vmassol: Help  
sdumitriu - (12:21): How do I upload something to the central maven repo? I don't know what to use for -Durl  
vmassol - (12:21): sdumitriu: hold on  
vmassol - (12:21): do you have the pom to upload ?  
sdumitriu - (12:21): The jar  
vmassol - (12:21): (or does it  need to be generated?)  
sdumitriu - (12:21): It's not a maven project  
vmassol - (12:21): that's not related  
vmassol - (12:21): you need a pom  
sdumitriu - (12:21): No, it can be generated automatically  
vmassol - (12:21): the upload tool can generate it but it won't discover transtivite deps  
sdumitriu - (12:22): mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=info.informatica -DartifactId=css4j -Dversion=0.10 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=css4j-0.10.jar -Durl=sftp://[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)//home/maven/public\_html -DrepositoryId=xwiki  
sdumitriu - (12:22): OK, I can write a pom then  
vmassol - (12:22): so if you need deps you 'll need to write the pom  
vmassol - (12:23): -Durl=scp://maven.xwiki.org/home/maven/public\_html/externals -DrepositoryId=maven.xwiki.org  
sdumitriu - (12:23): The older version didn't list deps either: http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/info/informatica/css4j/0.4.0/css4j-0.4.0.pom  
vmassol - (12:23): to generate pom : http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-deploy-plugin/deploy-file-mojo.html#generatePom

vmassol - (13:41): sdumitriu: should XWiki be a wiki word?

vmassol - (13:42): (right now XWiki is considered a wiki word by the impl I have)

vmassol - (13:42): no to mandate at least one lowercase letter?

vmassol - (13:43): or no, it shouldn't be a wiki word?  
sdumitriu - (13:43): Shouldn't be wikiword
